name: email
longDescription: Email address to login to WebODM

name: projectName
longDescription: Name of the project that the mapping task to be saved under.

name: taskName
longDescription: Name of the task on WebODM.

name: smrfScalar
longDescription: Simple Morphological Filter elevation scalar parameter.

name: opensfmDepthmapMinPatchSd
shortDescription: opensfm depthmap minimum patch standard deviation
longDescription: When using PATCH_MATCH or PATCH_MATCH_SAMPLE, controls the standard deviation threshold to include patched. Patches with lower standard deviation are ignored.

name: pcClassify
longDescription: Classify the point cloud outputs using a Simple Morphological Filter. You can control the behaviour of this option by tweaking the --dem-* parameters.

name: smrfWindow
longDescription: Simple Morphological Filter window raduis parameter.

name: meshOctreeDepth
longDescription: Oct-tree depth used in the mesh reconstruction, increase to get more vertices recommended values are 8-12.

name: minNumFeatures
longDescription: Minimum number of features to extract per image. More features leads to better results but slower execution.

name: resizeTo
longDescription: Resizes images by the largest side for feature extraction purposes only. Set to -1 to disable. this does not affest the final orthophoto resolution quality and will not resize the original images.

name: smrfSlope
longDescription: Simple Morphological Filter slope parameter (rise over run).

name: rerunFrom
longDescription: Can be one of: none | dataset | split | merge | opensfm | mve | odm_filterpoints | odm_meshing | mvs_texturing | odm_georeferencing | odm_dem | odm_orthophoto

name: use3dmesh
longDescription: Use a fill 3D mesh to compute the orthophoto instead of a 2.5D mesh. This option is a bit faster and provides similar results in planar areas.

name: orthophotoCompression
longDescription: Set the compression to use. Note that this could break gdal_translate if you don't know what you are doing.

name: mveConfidence
longDescription: Dicard points that have les than a certain confidence threshold. This only affects dense reconstructions performed with MVE. Higher values discard more points.

name: texturingSkipHoleFilling
longDescription: Skip filling holes in the mesh.

name: texturingSkipGlobalSeamLeveling
longDescription: Skip global seam leveling. Useful for IR data.

name: texturingNadirWeight
longDescription: Affects orthophotos only. Higher values result in sharper corners, but it can affect colour distribution and blurriness. Use lower values for planar areas and higher values for urban areas. The default value works well for most scenarios.

name: texturingOutlierRemovalType
longDescription: Type of photometric outlier removal method.

name: othrophotoResolution
longDescription: Orthophoto resoultion in cm/pixel.

name: dtm
longDescription: Use this tag to build a DTM (Digital Terrain Model, ground only) using a simple morphological filter. Check the --dem* and --smrf* parameters for finer tuning.

name: orthophotoNoTiled
longDescription: Set this parameter if you want a stripped geoTIFF.

name: demResolution
longDescription: DSM/DTM resoultion in cm/pixel.

name: meshSize
longDescription: The maximum vertex count of the output mesh.

name: forceGPS
longDescription: Uses images' GPS exif data for reconstruction, even if there are GCPs present. This flag is useful if you have high precision GPS measurements. If there are no GCPs, this flag does nothing.

name: ignoreGsd
longDescription: Ignore ground sampling distance (GSD). GSD caps the maximum resolution of image outputs and resizes images when necessary, resulting in faster processing and lower memory usage. Since GSD is an estimate, sometimes ignoring it can result in slightly better image output quality.

name: buildOverviews
longDescription: Build orthophoto overviews using gdaladdo.

name: opensfmDense
longDescription: Use opensfm to compute dense point cloud alternatively.

name: opensfmDepthmapMinConsistentViews
longDescription: Minimum number of views that should reconstruct a point for it to be valid. Use lower values if your images have less overlap. Lower values result in denser point clouds but with more noise.

name: texturingSkipLocalSeamLeveling
longDescription: Skip local seam blending.

name: texturingKeepUnseenFaces
longDescription: Keep faces in the mesh that are not seen in any camera.

name: debug
longDescription: Print debug messages.

name: useExif
longDescription: Use this tag when you have a gcp_list.txt but want to use exif geotags instead.

name: meshSamples
longDescription: Number of points per octree node. Recommended and Default: 1

name: pcSample
longDescription: Filters the point cloud by keeping only a single point around a radius N. This can be useful to limit the output resolution of the point cloud. Set to 0 to diable sampling.

name: matcherDistance
longDescription: Distance threshold in meters to find pre-matching images based on exif data. Set matcher-neighbors and this to 0 to skip pre-matching.

name: splitOverlap
longDescription: Radius of the overlap between submodels. After grouping images into clusters, images that are closer that this radius to a cluster are added to the cluster. This is done to ensure that the neighboring submodels overlap.

name: demDecimation
longDescription: Decimate the points before generatiing the DEM. 1 is no decimation (full quality). 100 decimates ~99% of the points. Useful for speeding up the generation.

name: orthophotoCutline
longDescription: Generates a polygon around the cropping area that cuts the orthophoto around the edges of the feature. This polygon can be useful for stitching seamless mosaics with multiple overlapping orthophotos.

name: pcFilter
longDescription: Filters the point cloud by removing the points that deviate more that N standard deviations from the local mean. Set to 0 to disable filtering.

name: split
longDescription: Average number of images per submodel. When splitting a large dataset into smaller submodels, images are grouped into clusters. This value regulates the number of images that each cluster should have on average.

name: fastOrthophoto
longDescription: Skips dense reconsturction and 3D model generation. It generates an orthophoto directly from the sparse reconstruction. If you just need an orthophoto and do nopt need a full 3D model, turn on this option. Experimental.

name: pcEpt
longDescription: Export the georeferenced point cloud in the Entwine Point Tile (EPT) format.

name: crop
longDescription: Automatically crop image outputs by creating a smooth buffer around the dataset boundaries, shrunk by N meters. Use 0 to disable cropping.

name: pcLas
longDescription: Export the georeferenced point cloud in LAS format.

name: merge
longDescription: Choose what to merge in the merge step in a split dataset. By default all avaiable outputs are merged.

name: dsm
longDescription: Use this tag to build a DSM (Digital Surface Model, ground + objects) using a progressive morphological filter. Check the --dem* parameters for finer tuning.

name: demGapfillSteps
longDescription: Number of steps used to fill areas with gaps. Set to 0 to disable gap filling. Starting witha radius equal to the output resulotion, N different DEMs are generated with progressively bigger radius using the inverse distance weighted (IDW) algorthim and merged together. Remaining gaps are then merged using nearest neighbour interpolation.

name: meshPointWeight
longDescription: This floating point number specifies the importance that interpolation of the point samples is given in the formulation of the screen Poisson equation. The results of the original (unscreened) Poisson Reconstruction can be obtained by setting this value to 0.

name: maxConcurrency
longDescription: The maximum number of processes to use in the various processes. Peak memory requirement is ~1GB per thread and 2 megapixel image resolution.

name: texturingToneMapping
longDescription: Turn on gamma tone mapping or none for no tone mapping.

name: demEuclidianMap
longDescription: Computes an euclidean raste map for each DEM. The map reports the distance from each cell to to the nearest NODATA value (before any hole filling takes place). This can be useful to isolate the areas that have been filled.

name: cameraLens
longDescription: Set a camera projection type. Manually set a value can help improve geometric undistortion. By default the application tries to determine a lens type from the images metedata.

name: skip3dmodel
longDescription: Skips generation of the full 3D model. This can save time if you only need 2D results such as orthophotos and DEMs.

name: matchNeighbours
longDescription: Number of nearest images to pre-match based on GPS exif data. set to 0 to skip pre-matching. Neighbours works together with Distance parameter, set both to 0 to not user pre-matching. OpenSFM uses both parameters at the same time, bundler uses only one which has value, prefering Neighbours parameter.

name: pcCsv
longDescription: Exports the georeferenced point cloud in CSV format.

name: endWith
longDescription: Can be one of: dataset, split, merge, opensfm, mve, odm_filterpoints, odm_meshing, mvs_texturing, odm_georeferencing, odm_dem, odm_orthophoto.

name: depthmapResolution
longDescription: Controls the density of the point cloud by setting the resolution of the depthmap images. Higher values take longer to compute but produce denser point clouds.

name: texturingDataTerm
longDescription: Data term:[area, gmi].

name: texturingSkipVisibilityTest
longDescription: Skip geometric visibility test.

name: opensfmDepthmapMethod
longDescription: Raw depthmap computation algorithm. PATCH_MATCH and PATCH_MATCH_SAMPLE are faster, but might miss some valid points. BRUTE_FORCE takes longer but produces denser reconstuctions.

name: useFixedCameraParams
longDescription: Turn off camera parameter optimization during bundler.

name: smrfThreshold
longDescription: Simple Morphological Filter elevation threshold parameter.

name: verbose
longDescription: Print additional messages to the console.

name: useHybridBundleAdjustment
longDescription: Run local bundle adjustment for every image added to the reconstruction and a global adjustment every 100 images. Speeds up reconstruction for very large datasets.
